name: The McLure Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a room last-minute,as most other places were full. Staff was nice but the property has seen better days. The whole lobby and most of the hallways reeked of smoke. The hallways, stairwells and especially the elevators were filthy. Room we had was a non-smoking room, but we could smell the cigarette residue beneath the heavy veil of Febreeze (nice try!). Bed linens were clean, except the bedspread has seen better days (I promptly pulled it off and left it in the closet!). Room was large but VERY dark - 2 small lamps, dark carpet, dark furniture, narrow window overlooking a dreary alley. Bathroom was also clean, but the flourescent lighting was worse than most, and the towels were threadbare and small. If you have no other options or really need to be in the heart of Wheeling, this may work for you. Otherwise, it's worth a drive to a newer and less depressing option.
reviews.title: About 30 years ago, it might have been OK

likes.liked: — smell of smoke, dark and depressing room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really have mixed feelings about this hotel. When you enter from the parking garage in the back, the stairwells are absolutely disgusting. Once you get into the regular hallways, though, they are not SO bad. Our room had one king bed and a bathroom. We were on the 6th floor so we had a good view of Wheeling (which is NOT much to look at, if you have been there). Our room was clean and seemed to be well maintained. The bed was nice but not overly comfortable. However, the second morning we were there, when housekeeping knocked on the door, I went out into the hall and told them directly that we did not want the room cleaned. I gave her our dirty towels and she gave us clean ones. We hung our 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the door and left for the day. When we got back, our room had been cleaned, and things had even been moved. We had personal items and valuables in the room, and there was no safe, so I was extremely upset. I called the front desk, and was told by this person that they would contact housekeeping and return my call. Two hours later, I gave up waiting and we went out again. When we checked out the next morning, we brought the situation to the attention of someone at the front desk. This person wrote down our names and phone numbers and promised to have the hotel manager contact us. Not surprisingly, we never heard from them. It was a nice stay for a very good price, but I'm not sure I would trust staying there again.
reviews.title: Great for the Price!

likes.liked: — The room was very nice for the price we paid, and it was convenient to get to the casino.
likes.disliked: — Our privacy was violated and the staff and management were not concerned at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been staying at this hotel almost monthly for two years with no problems until now. We usually come down to Wheeling to see the Nailers play hockey, as the rink is within walking distance. There is also a fantastic pizza place across the street from the hotel called DiCarlo's!
reviews.title: Insensitive staff and calls not returned.

likes.liked: — I have always enjoyed the location to the hockey arena and casino. DiCarlo's Pizza, too!

reviews.text: This hotel has always been the best choice for me among the hotels in downtown Wheeling because it does not make me wake up with a sore throat or stuffed up nose. (Wheeling Island is great, but it is on the other side of the river).
reviews.title: Wheeling's Best Kept Secret

reviews.text: I have asthma, and the weekend we stayed here was probably the first warm days of the year, as it went over 80. We checked in and were not informed that the hotel had not turned on the air conditioning and the boilers were still on.
reviews.title: Hockey Fans

reviews.text: I was traveling to Wheeling with a friend for a concert. We were looking for a place nearby the arena that we could walk if at all possible. I came across the McLure House and made a reservation. I was almost ready to cancel it when I read the reviews especially the "questionable characters." We never saw any by the way, however if we did, you have to take into consideration you are in an old part of town. It's not the hotels fault. I stuck with my instincts and kept our reservation. We got there around 4 and were greeted by a friendly person at the front desk who had no trouble splitting the cost of the room on 2 credit cards. I've had that issues at other hotels before. The lobby was impressive, very reassuring about keeping my reservation. Once we were in the room I was relieved, it was spacious, clean, and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Don't let negative reviews fool you...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here on New year's Eve 2009-2010. It's located in the center of the old section of Wheeling and is close to the casino, which was the purpose of my trip. I didn't check in until about 9:00 pm, which is kind of late I guess and the front desk clerk seemed a bit flustered, which I can understand because the hotel was totally booked that night and there seemed to be a lot going on. She was friendly though upon my check-in. There seemed to be events going on in the restaurant/bar area because of New Year's Eve, but I just went to the Casino.
reviews.title: New Year's Eve Stay

reviews.text: There were many people in their early to mid 20s at the hotel that night ( I saw them in the hallways and in the elevators) that were having fun and obviously had been drinking b/c of the holiday, which I understand. It's just kind of annoying dealing with drunk people when you're sober. I did have a coupon for the breakfast the next morning, but when the morning came, the restaurant was closed because it was New Year's Day, so there was no breakfast the morning I was there. Check out was quick and easy.
reviews.title: Clarion? McLure? Ramada? What Does This Place Want to Be? And Who's Responsible?

reviews.text: I didn't spend an increadable amount of time at the hotel that night, and the majority of the time I was there, I was sleeping. I liked the friendlieness of the staff. The room I stayed in was very spacious.
reviews.title: The good, the bad, the ugly

reviews.text: The reasons that I only gave this hotel a 3 out of 5 fot this night that I stayed was mainly because of the no breakfast the next morning. Some of the intoxicated young people I saw in the hallways and in the elevators were kind of annoying, but that isn't the fault of the hotel. The bathroom in the room could also use an update. The toilets are like the ones you see in a public restroom....the ones with the metal stick going to the side you usually use your foot to flush, as opposed to a normal toilet. I've never seen toilets like this in an actual hotel room before, and I've been to a lot of hotels in my lifetime. The rest of the bathroom could use a bit of freshing up also, like updating the wallpaper and maybe just putting more things in there to make it look nice, but nothing major.
reviews.title: O.K. Place to Spend the Night

likes.liked: — Price, historic location, ease of use

reviews.text: We attended a wedding and our family had three rooms. The problems we encounted were numerous. First, the a/c either ran all the time (freezing) or did not run (hot). The wall were thin and the noise of slamming doors and running water was very loud. We asked for queen beds and all three rooms had what looked like small full beds. The wall paper was coming off at the seams and they had used staples to hold them down. The toliet was louder than an airlane flush. The carpet was in dire need of cleaning, The TV was an old CRT and the picture was very poor. The breakfast consisted of some fruit, packaged sweet rolls, coffee and orange juice. The only nice thing about the Mclure was the entrance and it was close to the wedding receiption. Since the hotel said they were full we could not request another room.
reviews.title: Has seen better days. We will not be back.

reviews.text: I noticed that most of the good reviews were from previous years. I would not recommend staying at this Hotel.
reviews.title: Disgusting.

reviews.text: Yellow stains on the sheets, trash unemptied, no toilet paper, floor unvacuumed, and the ice machine was broken. We asked for a new set of sheets and came back to the room 3 hours later to find they had still not been changed. Called again and waited 30 minutes, never heard from any staff members. Service was terrible, we were completely ignored and our room had not been cleaned whatsoever since previous guests.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Don't listen to the other reviews. This hotel is wonderful. My room was very large with two beds and beautiful furnishings. Everything was impecably clean and tasteful. The bathroom was so large I was surprised...you could actually move and and get ready with out walking into the main room. I couldn't have been happier. There was a large window that partialy opened for getting that fresh morning air. No the view wasn't great but I had a mirrored building in view that reflected the golden sunset and sunrise which I loved...Also the shower had great water preasure that felt good after long hot days..
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And if that wasn't enough my car was in a covered garage which kept the sun from beating on it. The breakfast in the lobby was a great added touch. The staff was incredable with giving directions...Chris helped me find North Wheeling and the entire staff was as nice and helpful as you could want. I was treated and felt like I was in a 4 star hotel. I love Wheeling the people, architechture, history and walking for hours seeing all the history and people. Most people I talked to were so proud of the city they lived in and were so ready to tell you all about the city and history. Stayng at the McClure allowed me great access for walking or driving anywhere in the area. I want to thank the staff of the McClure for helping me have a great vacation. I will be back and I hope everyone coming to Wheeling stays at the Mcclure and has the same experience I did. Rhonda Marie Rose
reviews.title: Good Experience Overall

reviews.text: I wanted to love this hotel but couldn’t. It is an older building in the downtown section of Wheeling. There is a convenient connected parking garage and the rooms were clean and everything worked. There is evidence that they are investing money to keep the hotel decent and I appreciate that because it is a cool builing. The problem is that I found the room dreary and the halls smelly from cigarette smoke.
reviews.title: convenient but not spectacular

reviews.text: I meant to write a review of this hotel sooner (I stayed in September 2011) but am just now getting around to it. I stayed at the McClure Hotel/McLure Hotel/whatever it's called for two nights during a work trip since it was recommended but I was VERY disappointed! Although I was with a group of 5 people, I had a room to myself and I did not feel comfortable or safe in the hotel AT ALL. From the minute you walk in, the hotel is musty and dark and the parking garage is a joke. It's large enough, sure, but it is really dark and the hotel entrances are very strange. My boss even said that up on the top floor, the entrance area was infested with spiders -- glad I didn't see that or I would've freaked! Plus, the garage butts up against what looked like run down apartments and you could see (and touch) the windows of the building - a bit weird.
reviews.title: Convenient but creepy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, my room wasn't bad. It was clean and spacious enough for one person, although the view of the roof left much to be desired. I was mostly comfortable in my room, but I did keep an uneasy feeling the entire time I was at the hotel -- maybe that was due to the overall feel of the place, though. In the mornings, they did have a free breakfast that consisted of juice and pre-packaged items like muffins and danishes. Honestly, I didn't mind it because it was free and after a couple of danishes and a banana, I was satisfied (I'm not one to complain if it's free).
reviews.title: Would not recommend

reviews.text: Considering everything, it's cool that his historic hotel is downtown but I wouldn't stay here again. My room was nice enough, but the entire property felt creepy and unsafe for a girl in her mid-twenties, especially while walking around alone. If I ever visit Wheeling again, I'll stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: Friendly staff but dirty room

reviews.text: I was not real familiar with Wheeling, WV but picked up some coupons from a rest stop and I called to make reservations. I got a desk clerk that was NOT pleasant, but because I was running out of options decided to spend the night there. Upon checking in I commented on how rudely I was treated over the phone. I was told by two of the clerks that they knew the young lady that helped me was having some personal problems at home and indeed probably took it out on me. Assured me that the staff was very nice. WE checked in found our room in great need of a make over. When we opened the door and turned on the light switch we found the bulb was burned out. It was tidy, basic and old. Thank god we had a coupon I couldn't image paying Full price for staying in this dump. We immediately turned on the air conditioning to circulate the stale air and left for a few hours. When we came back we found the room had not cooled down and figured it too was broke. They indicate that they have a continiental breakfast -they had some orange juice and a sleeve of donuts. Very sad! When the manager recognized us from check in and asked about our stay I told her of our disappointment in the room and stay at their establishment. She continued to make excuses and although was polite and listened did NOTHING to correct the situation. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Save your money and sleep in your if you have too, because it is not worth spending your hard earned money on this hotel. Sorry just being honest.
reviews.title: A Good Bet for Wheeling

description: Less than a mile from the Wheeling Island Casino, the McLure Hotel is conveniently located in Downtown Wheeling, West Virginia. The property is a unique experience, a true piece of Americana. Presidents, Senators, actresses and actors have stayed at this great hotel at one point in the hotel's 150 year history. Nestled along the Ohio River and surrounded by inspiring American architecture our guests are never disappointed by the charm of Wheeling. From the McLure Team to you: We hope to see you at the McLure Hotel soon!
